<OLD - Uproar>

>
> Uproar listens to Wheelie thoughtfully with a sigh to =
his voice.  He sits down and hangs his head low.
> 
> " you're right, war j=
ust never seems ta just go away.  It just keeps going no matter what we do.=
  Anyway, you're about ta get grilled by Tucson or in for one of his lectur=
es, depending on his mood.  Good chance he's still in a sour mood."
> 
> He=
 gets up and continues to escort Wheelie to Tucson's quarters.  They come t=
o a waiting area teaming with many masterfully restored Cybertronian artafa=
cts personally restored by Tucson himself.  One such piece, an ancient cros=
s bow lies displayed within a glass case.  The lighting in the room reflect=
s off the weapon's frame.  Uproar stops to admire it.
> 
> " Wow....  I've =
never seen this before, look at it, Tucson actually restored this a long ti=
me ago.  And over to the left, an ancient Cybertronian time piece."
> 
> He=
 then points to other artifacts in the room.
> 
> " He restored all these t=
hings.  I've never seen anything like these.  It's like a window into the p=
ast."
> 
> Perpetually on the move and constantly busy.
>

Wheelie had allo=
wed himself o be led over to Tuscon's quarters, and then as he stood outsid=
e, and Uproar gestured to him to follow in, he quietly shook it, "Thank you=
, but it's his home, and we're alone.  It would be wrong to intake, without=
 his permission, or his walls they would break.  This is where he sets his =
spark, to go in without his duress would be to set it apart.  Thank you for=
 your time, but I shan't wish to go in with just thine."

Then, as he left,=
 giving a salute, going to transform to his small racer mode and began to d=
art along the corridors of the Autobase.
